creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: male figure standing in 3/4 pose, holding papers or cards in PL hand and a whip like object in PR hand; empty banderole behind man's upper torso; rocks and weeds at feet
inscription:
Signature, Date, Inscription

-- inscribed in plate at right: [Bin aber Ich auch / em Bawr\' hon Ich / doch zerschnitten / Schuh und / hosen ann.] 
-- illegible writing at base of verso; and in graphite: [82116] underlined with [fez] beneath it
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram and date in plate, at bottom: [MQD / 1587 ]
title: Peasant in Slashed Clothes
